body.value: On September 19th, 2019, the voices of Union Theological Seminary students echoed through the nave of James Memorial Chapel: “Woe to them who build their seminary by unrighteousness, their luxury condos by injustice.”

The students were paraphrasing the biblical prophet Jeremiah’s condemnation of Jehoiakim, a king who lived in reckless luxury through the oppression of those who labored. They weren’t criticizing a monarch, though, they were attempting to change the course of UTS history.

Only a few days after this incident, students scrawled Hebrew scripture from the Book of Daniel in gold paint over construction barriers on Union’s quad. These lines were a divine warning to Balthazzar, another king whose arrogance in neglecting his duties to God ended in destruction.
